availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Silas and Abigail Despain. Married to Agnes Despain. Married to Ellen Despain. Father of Edward H. Despain, Abigail Despain, Laurie Despain, Leroy L. Despain, James B. Despain, and Bessie Despain. Farm hand in Green County, Kentucky, in 1860. Mustered into service as 3rd Sergeant of the 13th Kentucky Infantry Volunteer Regiment (U.S.A.) on October 29, 1861. Promoted to 2nd Sergeant in 1862. Promoted to 1st Sergeant on December 1, 1863. Promoted to 1st Lieutenant in August 1864. Mustered out in January 1865.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District no. 2, p. 136. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District no. 1, p. 683. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Illinois, Randolph County, p. 362. Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Illinois, Randolph County, 492. Twelfth Manuscript Census of the United States (1900), Population Schedules, Illinois, Randolph County, p. 9. Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 264. Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 866. Find A Grave, "Jesse H. Despain (unknown-1910)," Memorial # 31825540, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/31825540 (accessed August 13, 2018).
